sentence.Network_en: There is scant evidence of strong economic growth to come.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有足够的证据表明经济将会突飞猛进。

sentence.Network_en: In fact, Richard Savage had known Edward Bellamy a scant five hours.
sentence.Network_cn: 实际上，理查德·萨维奇和爱德华·贝拉米相识才仅仅5个小时。

sentence.Network_en: This hole was a scant .23 inches in diameter.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个洞眼的直径只有0.23英寸。

scant 不足的scant 少的scantling draft ship 结构强度吃水船

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse skamt, neuter of skammr 'short'

entry.tran: 一丁点的;微小的;不足的;欠缺的
entry.def: You use scant to indicate that there is very little of something or not as much of something as there should be.

example.ex: She began to berate the police for paying scant attention to the theft from her car.
example.tran: 她开始痛斥警方对她车内被窃一案不够关注。

example.ex: ...forces that have shown scant respect for Red Cross markings or UN flags...
example.tran: 对红十字会标志和联合国旗帜不屑一顾的军队

entry.tran: (强调数目)小的,很小的，仅有的
entry.def: If you describe an amount as scant, you are emphasizing that it is small.

example.ex: This hole was a scant .23 inches in diameter...
example.tran: 这个洞眼的直径只有 0.23 英寸。

example.ex: In fact, Richard Savage had known Edward Bellamy a scant five hours.
example.tran: 实际上，理查德·萨维奇和爱德华·贝拉米相识才仅仅 5 个小时。

means.word_mean: 1. work hastily or carelessly; deal with inadequately and superficially
3. supply sparingly and with restricted quantities;
1. less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so;

auth_sentence.content: He paid us scant heed, beyond a nod.
auth_sentence.res_content: He paid us scant heed, beyond a nod.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He paid us scant heed, beyond a nod.

auth_sentence.content: Learn to cope with high anxiety and scant sleep.
auth_sentence.res_content: Learn to cope with high anxiety and scant sleep.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Learn to cope with high anxiety and scant sleep.

auth_sentence.content: He has paid scant attention to either since.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has paid scant attention to either since.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has paid scant attention to either since.

means.word_mean: 不足的; 缺乏的; 一丁点的; 微小的; 欠缺的

sentences.en: He paid scant attention to what was said.
Many mothers pay scant attention to their own needs when their children are small.
sentences.cn: 孩子们小的时候, 许多母亲都忽视自己的需求。

jushi.english: Many mothers pay scant attention to their own needs when their children are small.
jushi.chinese: 孩子们小的时候，许多母亲都忽视自己的需求。

jushi.english: The factory is scant of raw material.
